title: Let’s break down the clues step by step:
content:
1. Supersonic airliners on display  
   - On the left is a Tupolev Tu-144 in original Aeroflot livery, with tail number СССР-77112. On the right is an Air France Concorde bearing its airline’s name.  The only place in the world where both of these walk-in supersonic transports are exhibited side by side is the Technik Museum Sinsheim in Germany ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technik_Museum_Sinsheim)).

2. “SINSHEIM” lettering and signage  
   - Behind the Concorde you can just make out tall white posts spelling “SINSHEIM,” matching photographs of the museum’s forecourt entrances and roof-mounted supports ([flickr.com](https://www.flickr.com/photos/meteorry/44508942835?utm_source=openai), [sinsheim.technik-museum.de](https://sinsheim.technik-museum.de/en/concorde?utm_source=openai)).

3. Pine trees, building style and parking layout  
   - The background trees, the blue-grey industrial façade, and the pattern of parking-lot line-markings all precisely match publicly shared images of the museum’s open-air display area at Im Rosengarten ([abwww.sinsheim.technik-museum.de](https://abwww.sinsheim.technik-museum.de/?utm_source=openai), [flickr.com](https://www.flickr.com/photos/meteorry/44508942835?utm_source=openai)).

4. Local rail access  
   - The museum has its own Deutsche Bahn stop, “Sinsheim Museum/Arena,” which serves the immediate precinct.  That station stop since 2011 has been officially part of the Steinsfurt section of Sinsheim ([sinsheim.technik-museum.de](https://sinsheim.technik-museum.de/en/how-to-reach?utm_source=openai), [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinsheim_Museum/Arena_station?utm_source=openai)).

All these independent clues—airliner types and liveries, distinctive signage and mounts, the architectural style, and the dedicated local railway halt—point conclusively to the same location.

**Location Conclusion** Auto & Technik Museum Sinsheim (Im Rosengarten, Steinsfurt district), Sinsheim, Germany, Europe
